definition: to surrender and pay allegiance to
surname Gui

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: if no one comes to rescue us, we will surrender to you.
sentences.chinese: 若没有人救我们，我们就出来归顺你。

sentences.english: This success enabled him to claim the allegiance of central burma.
sentences.chinese: 这一胜利使他得以要求缅甸中部归顺于他。

sentences.english: If lords and princes could obey him, all things would abide by him.
sentences.chinese: 王侯若能持守他，万物会自动归顺。

sentences.english: He will bring many of Israel's people back to the Lord their God.
sentences.chinese: 他要劝导许多以色列人回心转意，归顺他们的上帝。

definition: to realign one's allegiance (to another religion, ruler etc)/to submit
to defect/to surrender/to capitulate
to rely on help from sb
to enlist enemy or rebel soldiers by offering amnesty/to bring to negotiated surrender
to surrender/surrender
to acknowledge allegiance to (some regime)/to serve
to go on a punitive expedition
to vow loyalty and devotion to
to surrender/to accept defeat
troops
to enlist enemy or rebel soldiers by offering amnesty
to send troops
surrendered enemy general
to dispatch an army/to send troops
to eliminate (by armed force)
to withdraw troops/to retreat
